mn1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Ukkaṭṭhā, in the Subhaga Forest at the root of a magnificent sal tree.
mn1:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
mn1:2.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the explanation of the root of all things.
mn1:2.2: Listen and apply your minds well, I will speak.”
mn1:3.1: “Take an unlearned ordinary person who has not seen the noble ones, and is neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the noble ones. They’ve not seen true persons, and are neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the true persons.
mn1:3.3: Having perceived earth as earth, they conceive it to be earth, they conceive it in earth, they conceive it as earth, they conceive that ‘earth is mine’, they take pleasure in earth.
mn1:3.5: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:4.2: Having perceived water as water, they conceive it to be water …
mn1:4.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:5.2: Having perceived fire as fire, they conceive it to be fire …
mn1:5.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:6.2: Having perceived air as air, they conceive it to be air …
mn1:6.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:7.2: Having perceived creatures as creatures, they conceive it to be creatures …
mn1:7.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:8.2: Having perceived gods as gods, they conceive it to be gods …
mn1:8.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:9.1: They perceive the Progenitor as the Progenitor.
mn1:9.2: Having perceived the Progenitor as the Progenitor, they conceive it to be the Progenitor …
mn1:9.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:10.2: Having perceived Brahmā as Brahmā, they conceive it to be Brahmā …
mn1:10.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:11.1: They perceive those of streaming radiance as those of streaming radiance.
mn1:11.2: Having perceived those of streaming radiance as those of streaming radiance, they conceive it to be those of streaming radiance …
mn1:11.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:12.1: They perceive those replete with glory as those replete with glory.
mn1:12.2: Having perceived those replete with glory as those replete with glory, they conceive it to be those replete with glory …
mn1:12.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:13.1: They perceive those of abundant fruit as those of abundant fruit.
mn1:13.2: Having perceived those of abundant fruit as those of abundant fruit, they conceive it to be those of abundant fruit …
mn1:13.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:14.1: They perceive the Vanquisher as the Vanquisher.
mn1:14.2: Having perceived the Vanquisher as the Vanquisher, they conceive it to be the Vanquisher …
mn1:14.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.

mn1:15.2: Having perceived the dimension of infinite space as the dimension of infinite space, they conceive it to be the dimension of infinite space …
mn1:15.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:16.1: They perceive the dimension of infinite consciousness as the dimension of infinite consciousness.
mn1:16.2: Having perceived the dimension of infinite consciousness as the dimension of infinite consciousness, they conceive it to be the dimension of infinite consciousness …
mn1:16.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:17.1: They perceive the dimension of nothingness as the dimension of nothingness.
mn1:17.2: Having perceived the dimension of nothingness as the dimension of nothingness, they conceive it to be the dimension of nothingness …
mn1:17.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:18.1: They perceive the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception as the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
mn1:18.2: Having perceived the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception as the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, they conceive it to be the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception …
mn1:18.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:19.1: They perceive the seen as the seen.
mn1:19.2: Having perceived the seen as the seen, they conceive it to be the seen …
mn1:19.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:20.1: They perceive the heard as the heard.
mn1:20.2: Having perceived the heard as the heard, they conceive it to be the heard …
mn1:20.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:21.1: They perceive the thought as the thought.
mn1:21.2: Having perceived the thought as the thought, they conceive it to be the thought …
mn1:21.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:22.1: They perceive the known as the known.
mn1:22.2: Having perceived the known as the known, they conceive it to be the known …
mn1:22.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:23.2: Having perceived oneness as oneness, they conceive it to be oneness …
mn1:23.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:24.2: Having perceived diversity as diversity, they conceive it to be diversity …
mn1:24.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:25.2: Having perceived all as all, they conceive it to be all …
mn1:25.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:26.2: Having perceived extinguishment as extinguishment, they conceive it to be extinguishment, they conceive it in extinguishment, they conceive it as extinguishment, they conceive that ‘extinguishment is mine’, they take pleasure in extinguishment.
mn1:26.4: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.
mn1:27.1: A mendicant who is a trainee, who hasn’t achieved their heart’s desire, but lives aspiring to the supreme sanctuary from the yoke, directly knows earth as earth.
mn1:27.2: Having directly known earth as earth, let them not conceive it to be earth, let them not conceive it in earth, let them not conceive it as earth, let them not conceive that ‘earth is mine’, let them not take pleasure in earth.
mn1:27.4: So that they may completely understand it, I say.

mn1:147.1: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha directly knows earth as earth.
mn1:147.2: Having directly known earth as earth, he does not conceive it to be earth, he does not conceive it in earth, he does not conceive it as earth, he does not conceive that ‘earth is mine’, he does not take pleasure in earth.

mn1:171.1: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha directly knows earth as earth.
mn1:171.2: Having directly known earth as earth, he does not conceive it to be earth, he does not conceive it in earth, he does not conceive it as earth, he does not conceive that ‘earth is mine’, he does not take pleasure in earth.
mn1:171.4: Because he has understood that taking pleasure is the root of suffering,
mn1:171.5: and that rebirth comes from continued existence; whoever has come to be gets old and dies.
mn1:171.6: That’s why the Realized One—with the ending, fading away, cessation, giving up, and letting go of all cravings—has awakened to the supreme perfect Awakening, I say.
